questions.question: Which of the following was a reason for growing problems in Rome?

choices.answer: growing discontent in the lower classes of Roman society
fighting between Tiberius and Julius Caesar

questions.question: True or False: As Rome grew, so did the gap between the rich and the poor.

questions.question: What was a major issue faced by small farmers in the Roman Empire?

choices.answer: They were hit hard by storms.
Wealthy farmers would often steal their crops.
They could not compete with slave labor from large estates.

questions.question: Why was Julius Caesar appointed dictator for life?

choices.answer: He defeated Pompey's armies in Greece, Asia, Egypt, & Spain.
He had the support of the army and a majority of the people.

questions.question: True or False: After the death of Julius Caesar, the republic would remain the same.
According to historians, when did the Roman Empire officially begin?
Which of the following was an effect of Pax Romana, the time of peace restored by Augustus?
Which of the following was an accomplishment of Augustus?

choices.answer: He glorified Rome by building beautiful public buildings.
He set up a civil service.
He freed all the slaves throughout the empire.
He created a system of government that survived for years.

choices.answer: During their rule, Romeâ€™s prosperity increased.

It was too large and difficult to govern.

questions.question: True or False: There were many successful slave revolts in Rome.
Why is Marcus Aurelius considered to be one of the last good emperors of Rome?

choices.answer: He put his people before his own ambitions.
He did all he could to improve the lives of the citizens.
